Message.Msg: ...and ya know the rest of the story,,,,,Hahahahahaha

Yeah, Noah's Ark. Flood wasn't worldwide and scripture doesn't say so. Just a poor translation (deliberate?) and dumb bells that won't look for the truth. The word, "erets" translated "world" and later "Ararat" simply "a land or country, ANY land or country. Mt "Ararat" wasn't known as such until over a century ago. It was Mt. Masiv before that. Look to the Tarim Basin as the site of Noah's flood. Interesting as they are finding Celtic settlements and graveyards all through that region. One large graveyard beside a large Asian lake is beside a flooded city in that lake. Like the 20,000 graves beside the Dead Sea but no city. Uh oh they found what looks like a city under the Dead Sea. Sodom and Gomorrah?
